alert.note: Alert for Auglaize; Darke; Miami; Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SHELBY, DARKE, SOUTHWESTERN AUGLAIZE AND WESTERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 228 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Versailles, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Sidney, Piqua, Greenville, West Milton, Minster, Versailles, Covington, Arcanum, Newport, Bradford, Anna, Fort Loramie, Jackson Center, Pleasant Hill, Ansonia, New Madison, Hardin, Webster and Wayne Lakes. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 76 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
